The City of San Antonio has awarded the Greater Austin Arts and Culture Commission (GABAC) $3.5 million for its first year of operation. The partnership between the two organizations was announced on May 17. Called the 'KIND Fairs, they will offer an opportunity for people to connect with local, regional, and national artists, galleries, museums, and businesses. The first event, titled the 'Art of the Future,' will feature more than 300 works by forty-four artists, including Hal Foster, Dennis Ho, Laura Owens, and Manfred Pérez. The second edition, titled “The Future Is Present,” will be held at the Austin Presbyterian Church (APCC), the mission of which is to “help people realize their dreams.” The grant is the second in five years for the commission, which was founded by the City of Austin’s Department of Cultural Affairs and Arts in 2018. The department received $3.5 million for the commission in 2019 and the funds were then redistributed by the city to the two organizations.
